page.title: 10LOCAL HEROES
page.content: Most of our heroes are connected with the sea, and in{All Saint's}Churchyard are 2 examples worthy of{biography. The first are the graves of two men who gave their lives when the S.S. Berlin sank in 1907. The chief steward {William Moor}was asked to take care of a boy of 5, and rather than save himself he gave his life, and was still holding the boy in his arms when his body was recovered. At the rear of the churchyard is the memorial to {Capt.Fryatt}who was arrested by the Germans after trying to ram a U-boat. Although not a member of the armed forces he was shot in 1916. After the war his body was returned, and {Mayflower School}log book tells how the children of the town lined the streets as his coffin was taken to the church for burial, having firstly been taken to{St.Paul's in London.
